result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose Daniel Hernandez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g) [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.
  • Possess Short-barreled Shotgun/Rifle [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.28(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: BOTH COUNTS:  Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.  Defendant to serve 10 (ten) days in HOC for failure to pay.
Concurrent with: AS TO COUNTS ONE AND TWO, EACH COUNT:  Concurrent with each other, and consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for 30 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.

No alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No association with known drug users, dealers.  No contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.

Pay all supervision fees.  Defendant to make regular payments.
Any other conditions as determined by agent.
AODA assessment.  Comply with any recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random drug tests.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendasnt that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Provide DNA sample.
Concurrent with: AS STATED IN COUNT ONE.

records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript SENTENCING HEARING  (49 pages) commencing JULY 11, 2014 received and filed.

Defendant Jose Daniel Hernandez in court with attorney Hazel Jean Washington.  Defendant Jose Daniel Hernandez in custody.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  5 YEARS, CONCURRENT TO COUNT 2, and CONSECUTIVE with any other sentence, with credit for 30 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  The defendant IS ELIGIBLE for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program and IS ELIGIBLE for the Challenge Incarceration Program. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  5 YEARS, CONCURRENT TO COUNT 1, and CONSECUTIVE with any other sentence, with credit for 30 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  The defendant IS ELIGIBLE for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program and IS ELIGIBLE for the Challenge Incarceration Program. 

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2:
The Court imposed the following conditions of extended supervision:  

- AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests.
- Seek and maintain full time employment.
- No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample, and to pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, assessments, and surcharges through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.  Defendant to serve 10 days in the HOC for failure to pay.
- Pay all supervision fees.  Defendant to make regular payments.
- Any other conditions as determined by agent.

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit; 
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.  aw
Character reference letters, received and filed.  aw

Received and filed.

Count 1:  Possession with intent to deliver controlled substance (THC), PTAC, As a party to a crime, use of a dangerous weapon, contrary to WI Stats sec. 961.41(1m)(h)2, 939.50()(h), 939.05, 939.63(1)(b).  A class H felony.

Count 2:  Posession of short-barreled shotgun or short-barreled rifle- PTAC, As a party to a crime, contrary to WI Stats sec. 941.28(2), 939.50(2)(h), 939.05.  A class H felony.

Count 3:  Bail Jumping (felony), contrary to WI Stat sec. 946.49(1)(b), 939.50(3)(h).  A class H felony.

Defendant Jose Daniel Hernandez in court with attorney Hazel J Washington.  Defendant Jose Daniel Hernandez in custody.  Megan M Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. 

AS TO COUNT 3 IN THE AMENDED INFORMATION:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered COUNT 3 dismissed, and read in.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2 OF THE AMENDED INFORMATION:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.
Case adjourned for sentencing on 7/11/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3. 
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed.  aw

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 11, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Hazel J Washington in court, defendant Jose Daniel Hernandez not in court, in custody.  Megan M Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for projected guilty plea on 5/28/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Plea hearing scheduled for May 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gregory A Renden in court, defendant Jose Daniel Hernandez not in court, in custody.  Dennis P Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Megan Williamson.
Defendant has a pending DPA, in which state will check on status before giving an offer to defense.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 5/19/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jose Daniel Hernandez in court with attorney Earlean Laster for Hazel J Washington.  Defendant Jose Daniel Hernandez in custody.  Chris Liegel for Megan M Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Jose Daniel Hernandez in court with attorney Gregory A Renden.  Defendant Jose Daniel Hernandez in custody.  Paul Hauer for Megan M Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense Counsel provides the Court with a Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver and a Request of Substitution of Judge form.  Defendant then informs the Court that his family will be retaining Attorney Hazel Washington to represent him.  Case is temporarily passed.

Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE. Attorney Renden will remain on this matter until the next scheduled court date.  Previously provided forms are withdrawn and returned to Attorney Renden.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring and Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jose Daniel Hernandez in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Jose Daniel Hernandez in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 17, 2014 at 08:03 am.
